reviewText: I loved the absurdity of it, these cartoon sharks were eating people left and right before anyone bothered to take notice and by then they had a tsunami to worry about.  It's always something.This movie had it all: drama, melodrama, bad relationships, an engagement that went nowhere fast, and a snotty girl who just wouldn't stop screaming.  There were also not a few amusing sequences such as, "let's catch one!"  MMMM-yeah, I hear they make fine pets.  Or the overly familiar scene of the twosome parasailing (from the sharks point of view......oh look, they're dangling live bait in the water!  Snacks on a rope.).  I don't know which kept me more captivated; the animated CG sharks, the INTENSE acting, or the scintillating dialog: "you're awfully tall for a 5 year old."  Don't ask me to explain why, but I'm keeping this turkey to watch again.  This is so beyond bad or awful, it's genius.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Quite possibly the worst shark movie ever made.  Not only is the idea so far-fetched as to be totally incredulous, but it is so poorly acted and executed that you wonder who would have ever given a green light for this film.  Goblin sharks are rare but not thought to be extinct.  A Georgia shrimper caught one not so long ago.  They are pink and flabby with a small dorsal fin and feed mostly off crustaceans, hence this one found itself snagged in a shrimp net.  But, I suppose the idea of a "goblin" shark sounded like it came from the bowels of hell, stirred up by a poor CGI tsunami to terrorize folks on a Malibu beach.Of course the one person who knows anything about goblin sharks is one of the first to go.  This isn't an environmental awareness film.  What follows is one of the most silly chain of events I've ever seen.  It would be amusing if it had been more campy, but everyone seemed to take themselves so seriously.  You need someone like Jim Varney in a film like this.  Instead, we get Peta Wilson, who must be scraping the bottom of the barrel to get involved in this fiasco.SyFy channel is nothing like the old Sci-Fi channel.  It has become the brunt of jokes, including Stephen Colbert.  If it continues to produce trash like this, I imagine it will soon go bankrupt.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Saw the uncut version of this 2009 oddity in a private collection recently. This is an entirely derivative plot with a little Jaws, a little Bay Watch, and a little nothing in particular to recommend it. Having said that, I did enjoy it anyway. The action was fairly well paced. There were no plot stopping roller coaster ride shots. No preachy moralizing. And no gratuitous anything. All these points could be held against it. But,this movie was just unpretentious fun. I like insane sharks with pointy noses that can swim one hundred miles an hour. It was much better than the hacked up version on TV some months back.It's not National Geographic and it will never win any awards for anything. And it's no comedy. But it is fun, just because.'nuff said.  JPF

reviewText: I watch this movie every time I can when it airs on the Sci-Fi Channel network. Of course when I learn it was out on DVD I just had to get it. A little bit of Jaws and lot of Baywatch.  This movie start off making you wonder how good it will be with all the shots of bikini clad women seen just laying on the beach. It doesn't take lot till we have classic Jaws style shark attacks on scuba divers and para-sailers. The undersea earthquakes that brought the goblin sharks to Malibu is start the start of the problems as it also causes a Tsuanmi which trap our heroes out at sea in a life guard station trying to defend off the sharks. With the tidal wave damage to the coast line help isn't coming anytime soon.
summary: move over great white the goblins are here

reviewText: Malibu Shark Attack (David Lister, 2009)Oh, Peta Wilson, the things I will watch for you. And not just because as you get older, you resemble more and more a co-worker on whom I had a raging crush many years ago. (Okay, no, that is the only reason.) Including unbearable dreck like Malibu Shark Attack, a movie so monstrously stupid it should come with a Surgeon General's warning that it kills brain cells. I must say, however, that my opinion of this movie would have been entirely changed had the question "what is that?" been answered with "really bad animatronic effects, duh!". But alas, such was not to be.Wilson (La Femme Nikita--the TV show, not the movie) plays Heather, the leader of a Baywatch-style crew of lifeguards on the Malibu beach. There's some stuff about underwater earthquakes, and some stuff about dolphin sharks, and needless to say, it's the lifeguards vs. the sharks, with some other silly subplots thrown in for good measure (what's a big-nasty-animal movie without, for example, a ruthless developer?). Not that it matters, given that the main plot is brain-dead in the first place (seriously, sharks vs. lifeguards is the whole thing). Painful to watch, but still, not the worst thing I've seen this week. *
summary: Peta Wilson is not enough to save this dreck.

reviewText: I saw Swamp Shark and 2-headed shark before I saw this one and I must say those two were just a little better.This movie isn't horrible, but it's not that great either. The acting is better than 2-Headed Shark and so is the CGI. But, not as good as Swamp Shark CGI. The girls in this movie isn't as good as the girls in 2-Headed Shark.The acting here is better than the acting in the 2-headed shark, but not as good as the acting in Swamp Shark.The story is about the same for all three movies. Some kind of event happens and now we have dangerous shark in the water.Goblin Sharks are the worse shark I like for all three movies.If you like B rated shark movies than you probably going to watch this either way. Otherwise, you don't need to watch this, if you don't have to.

reviewText: Goblin sharks?  Cool.  The first time I was introduced to the goblin shark was in the video game "Endless Ocean 2" and I thought, "What?"  When I saw the trailer for this movie I thought that the movie looked like mindless fun.  It was.  This movie will never be regarded as a great movie, and the acting argues against it even being regarded as a good movie.  But so what?  It was fun.  There were lots and lots of scenes of the sharks (and they looked decent enough--the CGI, while not stellar, was not trying to overreach and make more of the action than it could), the ending (*SPOILER* some people survive) with how the humans kill off the final shark is both satisfying and ridiculous, and the movie is tame enough for a younger (but not too young--no one under 8) audience.  If you want a good killer shark film see "Jaws" or "Deep Blue Sea".  If you want something a little different and aren't expecting much check out Malibu Shark Attack.
summary: Are goblin sharks real?  You wouldn't know it from this movie but, apparently, yes.
